body:
> How do we know which repo they're in?

a) hard-code the github paths at least. People clong from there are inevitable.

b) the review tool can have a map of the known commits for each of the ~dozen subrepos. If "git-review" is being used in a repo we don't recognize from its upstream URL, we sniff to see which commit exists in the history to tell us which subrepo we're in.
